description: A Paramecia-type Devil Fruit that permanently lengthens and sharpens the user's nails, which are capable of creating razor-sharp gusts capable of cleaving through even hard materials like bedrock. The nails are also useful as close-quarter blades.

abilities.description: Eric releases a powerful air blade that slashes the enemy multiple times upon contact, strong enough to slice through rock.
Eric releases a single small air blade that is still powerful enough to slice through rock.
Eric's ultimate technique - he slashes many times, releasing multiple air blades toward the enemy before unleashing a powerful whirlwind of razor air that can effortlessly slice through solid rock.

keyMoments.title: Kama Kama no Kamaitachi Midareuchi Debut
keyMoments.description: Eric unleashes his ultimate technique for the first time, showcasing the full power of the Kama Kama no Mi.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the maximum offensive capability of the Kama Kama no Mi before Eric's defeat.

keyMoments.title: Eric Defeated Despite Devil Fruit Powers
keyMoments.description: Despite his Kama Kama no Mi abilities, Eric is decisively defeated by Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Mi powers.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that raw Devil Fruit power alone doesn't guarantee victory against a skilled opponent.

weaknesses.description: User cannot swim and becomes powerless in seawater or when submerged.

reveals.information: Ultimate technique Kama Kama no Kamaitachi Midareuchi can create a devastating whirlwind of razor air

etymology: The name 'kama' is derived from kamaitachi (鎌鼬), a Japanese yōkai thought to ride on the wind and use its razor-sharp, sickle-like claws to slash at human victims.

description: A Paramecia-type Devil Fruit that grants the user the ability to telepathically communicate with animals, allowing them to understand animal thoughts and communicate back to them.

abilities.description: The user can telepathically communicate with any animal, understanding their thoughts and conveying their own thoughts to the animals.

keyMoments.title: Apis Uses Her Powers to Protect the Dragons
keyMoments.description: Apis's decision to stay on Warship Island is directly tied to her Devil Fruit ability, which allows her to communicate with and protect the dragons.
keyMoments.significance: Her Devil Fruit power becomes the foundation for her life's purpose as guardian of the Dragon's Nest.

weaknesses.description: User cannot swim and becomes powerless in seawater or when submerged.

etymology: The name comes from 'hisohiso' (ひそひそ), a Japanese onomatopoeia for whispering.
